duck: Concatenation (mathematics), a mathematical operation that combines two vectors
Cat (Unix), a Unix command to write the contents of one or more files to the standard output
concatenation definition: to link together in a series or chain.
Packet concatenation, a computer networking optimization that coalesces multiple packets under a single header.
Concatenation, a computer programming operation that joins strings together
Concatenated SMS, a way of combining multiple SMS text messages sent to cellular phones

wiki.text: In formal language theory and computer programming, 'string concatenation' is the operation of joining two character strings end-to-end. For example, the concatenation of "snow" and "ball" is "snowball". In many programming languages, string concatenation is a binary infix operator. The "+" operator is often overloaded to denote concatenation for string arguments: "Hello, " + "World"; has the value "Hello, World".
wiki.title: concatenation
